entries.name: Creatures
entries: Mango the Landshark (DONE)
Giant Swarm of Wasps (DONE)

entries.name: Book
entries: Skeleton
TBD

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Charge
entries: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Equine Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Hooves
entries: Your hooves are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and Orc.

entries.name: Survivor
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Primal Intuition
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, and {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical Clay man is between two and thirty years old. The maximum Clay man lifespan remains a mystery; so far, Clay Men have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Clay Men take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you unconscious, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Specialized Design.
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Legacy of the Succubi
entries: You know the {@spell friends} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell charm person} spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell suggestion} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking {@dice 5d10+5|32 (5d10+5)} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: You can use your tail to perform the somatic components of spells, as if it were a free hand. Additionally, Your tail counts as a hand for casting Touch range spells.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The Mango has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Mango can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.
An Adult Mango is around 15ft long with tan, sandpaper-like skin. All Mangos have a red bowtie-like pattern on their neck.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}457 ({@damage 175d4}) piercing damage, or 215 ({@damage 86d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: The Nature of Swarms
entries: The swarms presented here aren't ordinary or benign assemblies of little creatures. They form as a result of some sinister or unwholesome influence. A vampire can summon swarms of bats and rats from the darkest corners of the night, while the very presence of a mummy lord can cause scarab beetles to boil up from the sand-filled depths of its tomb. A hag might have the power to turn swarms of ravens against her enemies, while a yuan-ti abomination might have swarms of poisonous snakes slithering in its wake. Even druids can't charm these swarms, and their aggressiveness is borderline unnatural.

item.name: Lazy Boomerang
entries: Returning Weapon
When thrown, roll a persuasion check, it takes 48-2*that roll (minimum 1 round) hours to return to you.
No obstacle can prevent the boomerang from returning.
No matter who threw the boomerang, it will always return to the attuned being.
The boomerang will accelerate such that it takes no more than 12 seconds to return.

item.name: Captain's Shield
entries: A round grey metal shield.
When Attuned, it acts as a +3 shield. It still provides the normal shield AC bonus even if not attuned.
You get a +3 to attack and Damage rolls made with this weapon when attuned.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: Can communicate telepathically with the Attuned being.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Has a fly speed of 20 ft for 10 rounds (or 1 minute if outside of combat) after which it falls out of the air.
It must move at least 10ft to stay airborne.

entries.name: Attack
entries: When thrown, it has a melee attack dealing {@dice 2d10} + Your Strength Modifier Bludgeoning Damage with a range of 20ft (min 10 ft) that moves it to be adjacent to the target. (Cannot attack after moving or move after attacking.)
When in your hand, it deals 3d10 Bludgeoning damage if used to make a melee weapon attack.

item.name: Betty
entries: A leather bound book with Ornate bronze and golden artwork.
There is a hidden switch on the back that prevents the magical properties from activating.
The book can project a harmless translucent image of any item it has the recipe for.
If you hold an item above the open book for 1 hour it will consume the item and create a recipe for it. (Does not work on Living things or Artifacts.)
If a Betty is crafted it automatically posesses the recipe for Betty and no other recipes. (Betty is the one exception to the no Artifacts rule.)

item.name: Realm Gate
entries: A large, (~12 foot) circle of an unknown material with strange carvings across the surface.
There are 24 flat circular plates spread around all but the bottom quarter of the ring.
There is also a pedestal with 101 buttons nearby. All but one have strange runes, and the remaining button in the center is a large red circle.

entries.caption: Partial Dial Effects
rows: Random Dial Realm, Plane, and Location
Fixed dial Realm, Random Dial Plane and Location
Fixed Dial Realm and Plane, Random Dial Location
Fixed Dial Realm, Plane, and Location
footnotes: What each dial does is up to the DM.
